intro: Ghaznianthus rechingeri, commonly known as the Afghan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It has lanceolate leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
